simple

Class NumberIterator

  • java.lang.Object
    • simple.NumberIterator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterator<String>

    public final class NumberIterator
extends Object
implements Iterator<String>
    Iterates over a range of numbers.
    [001..100] = 001,002,003,..,099
    [001...100] = 001,002,003,..,100
    [1..100] = 1,2,3,..,99
    [0..100,5] = 0,5,10,..,95
    [0...100,5] = 0,5,10,..,100
    Inspired by the Range class in Ruby.
    Created: Jul 9, 2010
    Author:
    Kenneth Pierce

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NumberIterator(int start, int end, int step)
      Creates an inclusive iterator with no padding.
      NumberIterator(int start, int end, int step, int places)
      Creates an inclusive iterator.
      NumberIterator(int start, int end, int step, int places, boolean inclusive) 
      NumberIterator(String format)
      Create a number iterator based on a range.
      [001..100] = 001,002,003,..,099
      [001...100] = 001,002,003,..,100
      [1..100] = 1,2,3,..,99
      [0..100,5] = 0,5,10,..,95
      [0...100,5] = 0,5,10,..,100
